results.title: Report 4000 L portable tape recorder
results.brief_description:
Uher 4000 Report - L portable tape recorder in leather carrying case with microphone

The 4000 Report series were widely used by radio news journalists, and also used by law enforcement personnel for telephone wire taps and for recording interrogations, or for covertly recording an important conversation in a room.

results.title: Prague 2000
results.brief_description: This tour of the beautiful city of Prague in the Czech Republic presents the rich history and full range of museums, churches and palaces of Bohemian kings. Beginning in the Old Town Square, we travel across the famous Charles Bridge to Mala Strana and Hradcany to visit all of the famous tourist destinations within the city and along the Vltava River. Highlights include St Nicholas Church, Franz Kafka’s house and museum, the Jewish Quarter, Prague Castle, the Infant Jesus of Prague, Dvorak Hall and Prague Zoo.

results.title: Powaqqatsi: Life in transformation [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Reggio, Lawrence Taub, Mel Lawrence and Golan-Globus
results.brief_description: A feast for the eyes and ears - “Powaqqatsi: life in transformation” is a spellbinding look at life on our planet from the depths of an iron ore mine in Brazil, to the commotion of city life in the concrete jungle of Hong Kong. Featuring hypnotic music by renowned composer Philip Glass, this is a truly amazing and totally original experience in modern cinema.

results.title: Pour Clemence = for Clemence
results.brief_description:
After losing his job, a 40 year old engineer decides to change the major orientation of his life and become a house husband. But this sudden change in domestic arrangements upsets his wife and daughter.

Credits: Director, Charles Belmont ; writers, Charles Belmont, Marielle Issartel ; photography, Philippe Rousselot ; music, Michel Portal, Jean Schwarz.
Cast: Jean Crubelier, Eva Darlan, Lucia Bensasson, Jacques David, Claude Debord, Jean Deschamps.

results.title: Fantasia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated feast of music and visuals. Featuring a soundtrack of classical music, including selections by Bach, Tchaikovsky and Moussorgsky, the film weds animated narratives to the famous musical pieces. “Fantasia” includes one of Disney’s most loved sequences, “The Sorcerer’s Apprentice”. At its best the film’s animation remains magical and visually breath-taking.

constellations_other.name: Circling expanded cinema
constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

results.title: Fanny
results.brief_description:
Fanny has allowed Marius to leave her to become a sailor without telling him she was expecting his child. In order to avoid dishonor, Fanny’s mother, Honorine, is pushing the young woman to marry the wealthy and much older Panisse. Upon his return Marius learns about the wedding and the reason for so much haste. Careful to secure a future for ‘his’ grand son, Cesar, Marius’ father, persuades him to renounce any claim to the child. ‘Fanny’ is the second installement of Pagnol’s Marseille trilogy, started with ‘Marius’.

Credits: Producer, Roger Richebe ; director, Marc Allegret ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Nicola Toporkoff ; music, Vincent Scotto, Georges Sellers ; producer’s assistants, Pierre Prevert, Yves Allegret.
Cast: Raimu, Orane Demazis, Pierre Fresnay, Fernand Charpin, Alida Rouffe.

results.title: The National fitness story
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Artransa Park Studios and Shell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
The Federal Minister for Health briefly introduces the “Fit to Live” series, after which the overall objectives and activities of the National Fitness movement throughout Australia are depicted. Story by Noel McDonald with Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
Part of an instructional film series from 1969-70 about the training of Australia’s youth. Thirteen colour films of ten minutes duration were made under the auspices of the Cultural Council for National Fitness. The films focus on National Fitness Camps, sports, family recreation and exercises for people of all ages. Sponsored by the Shell Company, the films were made to emphasis the need for physical fitness amongst all age groups. This film deals with the prevention and rehabilitation of heart disease through exercise.

results.title: Family recreation
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Artransa Park Studios and Shell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
Australians in most walks of life now have more leisure time at their disposal. There are many enjoyable, interesting and healthy ways of utilising this leisure time, and this film gives many suggestions - and much food for thought.
